intro: Euphrasia minima subsp. sicardii, commonly known as Sicard's lesser eyebright, is a small herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, glandular-stemmed structure. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, yellowish flowers with prominent, showy eyespots, which are typical of the genus Euphrasia. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
